title: Augusta County: Various authors to Annie Harris, [date unknown]
summary: This note, written on a pay sheet for the Baltimore and Ohio Railroad Company, contained two separate parts, both to Ms. Harris. The first was written by a Dr. "S. A. T.," the second by Tony Pastor. The first letter describes camp life in some detail, including exhaustive marches, hot weather, and mental exhaustion caused by false alarms of battle. The second letter mentions sickness in the camp and includes Pastor's usual complaints that Annie does not write often enough.
keywords: Camp Life, Medicine/Hospitals, Military Strategy, Patriotism, Troop Movement, American Civil War
